comments:

3. Launched my plug-in in the Runtime Workbench.

Strange, since it's casting to IPerspectiveFactory, and ResourcePerspective 
most certainly is one, and they're both in the same plugin.
Was there anything in the .log?

Nope, no log...
Hmm, I just backed up to I1218 and I get the same problem (this is on '98). But 
on my win2k box I1218 works fine with the same setup. Not sure what's going 
on...

User error. Apparently I cannot set up a simple self-hosting configuration, 
having done it hundreds of times before...
(I didn't properly uncheck the plug-ins in the PDE preferences page so they 
wouldn't be run as external plug-ins). After unchecking ui, swt, and the other 
plug-ins that I had as binary projects in the workspace, everything works fine.
I'm still unclear on why this broke in the first place, but it seems to be fine 
now.

Strange.  Maybe it got a binary class for the interface but a source class for 
the concrete class (or vice versa) and thought they were incompatible.
Closing PR.
